On 20.03.2009, at 12:28, Eric J. Bowman wrote:

> >
> > If you find yoursel=
f in need of a batch operation, then most likely
> > you just haven=92t def=
ined enough resources.
> >
>
> True enough. A collection resource can be cr=
eated which contains only
> members 2, 5 and 9 and treats DELETE as a store=
d procedure to delete  
> all
> members along with the collection resource =
itself. No problem. But,
> hypothetically, why? I still see no compelling r=
eason to optimize
> DELETE at the expense of the visibility which allows pr=
oper cache
> behavior.

Atomicity?

Stefan
